{"doc":{"info":{"calaisRequestID":"778bf8e4-3e28-7ba1-146f-22d103875f0e","id":"http://id.opencalais.com/8Lgjwu7nqtim-yDUkoDb6g","docId":"http://d.opencalais.com/dochash-1/838c9667-4cf8-35d4-95fe-682e9c727b6b","document":" ï¿¼Back Sc Front 9-64 20/4/90 4:30 pm Pagft\"Np8 Mesalliance I am divorcing my dog. He never cared for me: we were unsuited. His lickspittle allegiance lies wetly elsewhere, his easy bonhomie bounces over others. I am barely acknowledged: a mere opener of tins, prison warder, valet. In front of other dogs he is insubordinate. I mean to dispose of him by auction. He suspects this/ snuffs and sighs as I batten down for the evening. (A window left ajar and he\u2019s gone.) The back-up plan involves garden work. He peers into my excavations glaucous-eyed and curious, but feints and weaves at my attempts to catch and measure him.
